The response of the company to the issues has also been criticized, with accusations of lack of transparency and accountability.

However, it's not impossible for Boeing to recover and regain the trust of customers. The company has taken steps to address the issues, including updating the software and systems on the 737 MAX and changing some of its senior leadership. It's also working with regulatory agencies around the world to ensure that the plane is recertified and deemed safe to fly.

Recovery will not be immediate or easy, and Boeing will need to demonstrate that it's taken the necessary steps to prevent similar issues from happening in the future. Boeing will need to show that it's committed to safety and that it has the capability and expertise to design and manufacture safe and reliable aircraft. Regaining the trust of customers and stakeholders will require significant effort and time, but it's not impossible.
